segment.source: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: After you install the MBAM 2.5 Server software, you can use configure MBAM 2.5 Server features by using Windows PowerShell cmdlets or the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.
segment.target: After you install the MBAM 2.5 Server software, you can use configure MBAM 2.5 Server features by using Windows PowerShell cmdlets or the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.

segment.source: This topic describes how to configure MBAM 2.5 by using the Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: This topic describes how to configure MBAM 2.5 by using the Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: To use the wizard instead, see Configuring the MBAM 2.5 Server Features.
segment.target: To use the wizard instead, see Configuring the MBAM 2.5 Server Features.

segment.source: In this topic
segment.target: In this topic

segment.source: This topic includes the following information about using Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM:
segment.target: This topic includes the following information about using Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM:

segment.source: For information about the Get-MbamBitLockerRecoveryKey and Get-MbamTPMOwnerPassword Windows PowerShell cmdlets, which are used to administer MBAM, see Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5.
segment.target: For information about the Get-MbamBitLockerRecoveryKey and Get-MbamTPMOwnerPassword Windows PowerShell cmdlets, which are used to administer MBAM, see Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5.

segment.source: How to load Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM 2.5
segment.target: How to load Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM 2.5

segment.source: For a list of the Windows PowerShell cmdlets on TechNet, see Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack Automation with Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For a list of the Windows PowerShell cmdlets on TechNet, see Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack Automation with Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: To load the MBAM 2.5 Help for Windows PowerShell cmdlets after installing the MBAM Server software
segment.target: To load the MBAM 2.5 Help for Windows PowerShell cmdlets after installing the MBAM Server software

segment.source: Open Windows PowerShell or Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).
segment.target: Open Windows PowerShell or Windows PowerShell Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE).

segment.source: Type Update-Help –Module Microsoft.MBAM.
segment.target: Type Update-Help –Module Microsoft.MBAM.

segment.source: How to get Help about an MBAM Windows PowerShell cmdlet
segment.target: How to get Help about an MBAM Windows PowerShell cmdlet

segment.source: Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM is available in the following formats:
segment.target: Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM is available in the following formats:

segment.source: Windows PowerShell Help format
segment.target: Windows PowerShell Help format

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: At a Windows PowerShell command prompt, type Get-Helpcmdlet
segment.target: At a Windows PowerShell command prompt, type Get-Helpcmdlet

segment.source: To upload the latest Windows PowerShell cmdlets, follow the instructions in the previous section on how to load Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM.
segment.target: To upload the latest Windows PowerShell cmdlets, follow the instructions in the previous section on how to load Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM.

segment.source: Configurations that you can do only with Windows PowerShell but not with the MBAM Server Configuration wizard
segment.target: Configurations that you can do only with Windows PowerShell but not with the MBAM Server Configuration wizard

segment.source: Configurations that you can do only by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configurations that you can do only by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Install the web services on a separate computer from the web applications.
segment.target: Install the web services on a separate computer from the web applications.

segment.source: Using the wizard, you must install the web services and web applications on the same computer.
segment.target: Using the wizard, you must install the web services and web applications on the same computer.

segment.source: Enable reports on a separate reporting services point without installing all of the Configuration Manager objects.
segment.target: Enable reports on a separate reporting services point without installing all of the Configuration Manager objects.

segment.source: Delete all of the objects from Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Delete all of the objects from Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Deleting the objects in turn deletes all of the compliance data from Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Deleting the objects in turn deletes all of the compliance data from Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Enter a custom connection string for the databases.
segment.target: Enter a custom connection string for the databases.

segment.source: Example: To configure the web applications to work with mirroring, you must use the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet to specify the appropriate failover partner syntax in the connection string.
segment.target: Example: To configure the web applications to work with mirroring, you must use the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet to specify the appropriate failover partner syntax in the connection string.

segment.source: Skip validation and configure a feature even though the prerequisite check failed.
segment.target: Skip validation and configure a feature even though the prerequisite check failed.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot disable the MBAM databases with a Windows PowerShell cmdlet or the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.
segment.target: You cannot disable the MBAM databases with a Windows PowerShell cmdlet or the MBAM Server Configuration wizard.

segment.source: To prevent the accidental removal of your compliance and audit data, database administrators must remove databases manually.
segment.target: To prevent the accidental removal of your compliance and audit data, database administrators must remove databases manually.

segment.source: Prerequisites and requirements for using Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM Server features
segment.target: Prerequisites and requirements for using Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM Server features

segment.source: Before starting the configuration, complete the following prerequisites.
segment.target: Before starting the configuration, complete the following prerequisites.

segment.source: Account-related prerequisites
segment.target: Account-related prerequisites

segment.source: Prerequisite
segment.target: Prerequisite

segment.source: Details or additional information
segment.target: Details or additional information

segment.source: Create the required accounts.
segment.target: Create the required accounts.

segment.source: See section Required accounts and corresponding Windows PowerShell cmdlet parameters later in this topic.
segment.target: See section Required accounts and corresponding Windows PowerShell cmdlet parameters later in this topic.

segment.source: User accounts and groups that you pass as parameters to the Windows PowerShell cmdlets must be valid accounts in the domain.
segment.target: User accounts and groups that you pass as parameters to the Windows PowerShell cmdlets must be valid accounts in the domain.

segment.source: You cannot use local accounts.
segment.target: You cannot use local accounts.

segment.source: Specify accounts in the down-level format.
segment.target: Specify accounts in the down-level format.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: domainNetBiosName\userdomainNetBiosName\group
segment.target: domainNetBiosName\userdomainNetBiosName\group

segment.source: Permission-related prerequisites
segment.target: Permission-related prerequisites

segment.source: Prerequisite
segment.target: Prerequisite

segment.source: Details or additional information
segment.target: Details or additional information

segment.source: You must be an administrator on the local computer where you are configuring the MBAM feature.
segment.target: You must be an administrator on the local computer where you are configuring the MBAM feature.

segment.source: Use an elevated Windows PowerShell command prompt to run all Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: Use an elevated Windows PowerShell command prompt to run all Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: For the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet only:
segment.target: For the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet only:

segment.source: You must have create any database permissions on the instance of the target Microsoft SQL Server database.
segment.target: You must have create any database permissions on the instance of the target Microsoft SQL Server database.

segment.source: This user account must be a part of the local administrators group or the Backup Operators group to register the MBAM Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) Writer.
segment.target: This user account must be a part of the local administrators group or the Backup Operators group to register the MBAM Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) Writer.

segment.source: By default, the database administrator or system administrator has the required create any database permissions.
segment.target: By default, the database administrator or system administrator has the required create any database permissions.

segment.source: For more information about VSS Writer, see Volume Shadow Copy Service.
segment.target: For more information about VSS Writer, see Volume Shadow Copy Service.

segment.target: For the System Center Configuration Manager Integration feature only:

segment.source: Using Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM on a remote computer
segment.target: Using Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM on a remote computer

segment.source: When to use this capability
segment.target: When to use this capability

segment.source: When you want to configure the MBAM 2.5 Server features on a remote computer.
segment.target: When you want to configure the MBAM 2.5 Server features on a remote computer.

segment.source: The Windows PowerShell cmdlets are running on one computer, and you are configuring the features on a different, remote computer.
segment.target: The Windows PowerShell cmdlets are running on one computer, and you are configuring the features on a different, remote computer.

segment.source: What you have to do
segment.target: What you have to do

segment.source: To use Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM 2.5 Server features on a remote computer, you must:
segment.target: To use Windows PowerShell to configure MBAM 2.5 Server features on a remote computer, you must:

segment.source: Ensure that the MBAM 2.5 Server software has been installed on the remote computer.
segment.target: Ensure that the MBAM 2.5 Server software has been installed on the remote computer.

segment.source: Use the Credential Security Support Provider (CredSSP) Protocol to open the Windows PowerShell session.
segment.target: Use the Credential Security Support Provider (CredSSP) Protocol to open the Windows PowerShell session.

segment.source: Enable Windows Remote Management (WinRM).
segment.target: Enable Windows Remote Management (WinRM).

segment.source: If you fail to enable WinRM and to configure it correctly, the New-PSSession cmdlet that is described in this table displays an error and describes how to fix the issue.
segment.target: If you fail to enable WinRM and to configure it correctly, the New-PSSession cmdlet that is described in this table displays an error and describes how to fix the issue.

segment.source: For more information about WinRM, see Using Windows Remote Management.
segment.target: For more information about WinRM, see Using Windows Remote Management.

segment.source: Why you have to do it
segment.target: Why you have to do it

segment.source: This protocol enables the Windows PowerShell cmdlets to connect to Active Directory Domain Services by using the user’s administrative credentials.
segment.target: This protocol enables the Windows PowerShell cmdlets to connect to Active Directory Domain Services by using the user’s administrative credentials.

segment.source: You might get a validation error if you start the Windows PowerShell session without this protocol.
segment.target: You might get a validation error if you start the Windows PowerShell session without this protocol.

segment.source: How to start a Windows PowerShell session with the CredSSP protocol
segment.target: How to start a Windows PowerShell session with the CredSSP protocol

segment.source: Type the following code at the Windows PowerShell prompt:
segment.target: Type the following code at the Windows PowerShell prompt:

segment.source: The following code shows an example.
segment.target: The following code shows an example.

segment.source: Required accounts and corresponding Windows PowerShell cmdlet parameters
segment.target: Required accounts and corresponding Windows PowerShell cmdlet parameters

segment.source: The following table describes the accounts that are required to configure MBAM 2.5 Server features.
segment.target: The following table describes the accounts that are required to configure MBAM 2.5 Server features.

segment.source: It also lists the corresponding Windows PowerShell cmdlet and parameter for which you have to specify the account during configuration.
segment.target: It also lists the corresponding Windows PowerShell cmdlet and parameter for which you have to specify the account during configuration.

segment.source: Cmdlet Parameter Type (User or Group) Description Enable-MBAMDatabase
segment.target: Cmdlet Parameter Type (User or Group) Description Enable-MBAMDatabase

segment.source: AccessAccount
segment.target: AccessAccount

segment.source: User or Group
segment.target: User or Group

segment.source: Specify a domain user or group that has read/write permission to this database to give the web applications access to data and reports in this database.
segment.target: Specify a domain user or group that has read/write permission to this database to give the web applications access to data and reports in this database.

segment.source: If the value is a domain user, then the WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential parameter that is used when running the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet must use the same user account.
segment.target: If the value is a domain user, then the WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential parameter that is used when running the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet must use the same user account.

segment.source: If the value is a domain Users group, then the domain account that is used by the WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential parameter must be a member of this group.
segment.target: If the value is a domain Users group, then the domain account that is used by the WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential parameter must be a member of this group.

segment.source: ReportAccount
segment.target: ReportAccount

segment.source: User or Group
segment.target: User or Group

segment.source: Specify a domain user or Users group that has read-only permission to this database to provide the MBAM reports access to the compliance and audit data.
segment.target: Specify a domain user or Users group that has read-only permission to this database to provide the MBAM reports access to the compliance and audit data.

segment.source: If the value is a domain user, then the ComplianceAndAuditDBCredential parameter of the Enable-MbamReport cmdlet must use the same user account.
segment.target: If the value is a domain user, then the ComplianceAndAuditDBCredential parameter of the Enable-MbamReport cmdlet must use the same user account.

segment.source: If the value is a domain Users group, then the domain account that is used by the ComplianceAndAuditDBCredential parameter must be a member of this group.
segment.target: If the value is a domain Users group, then the domain account that is used by the ComplianceAndAuditDBCredential parameter must be a member of this group.

segment.source: Enable-MbamReport
segment.target: Enable-MbamReport

segment.source: ComplianceAndAuditDBCredential
segment.target: ComplianceAndAuditDBCredential

segment.source: User
segment.target: User

segment.source: Specifies the administrative credential that the local SSRS instance uses to connect to the MBAM Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Specifies the administrative credential that the local SSRS instance uses to connect to the MBAM Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: The domain user in the administrative credential must be the same as the user account that is used for the ReportAccount parameter, which is used while running the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet.
segment.target: The domain user in the administrative credential must be the same as the user account that is used for the ReportAccount parameter, which is used while running the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet.

segment.source: If a domain Users group was used with the ReportAccount parameter, this account should be a member of that group.
segment.target: If a domain Users group was used with the ReportAccount parameter, this account should be a member of that group.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The account specified in the administrative credentials should have limited user rights for improved security.
segment.target: The account specified in the administrative credentials should have limited user rights for improved security.

segment.source: Also, the password of the account should be set to not expire.
segment.target: Also, the password of the account should be set to not expire.

segment.source: ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup
segment.target: ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: Specifies the domain user group that has read permissions to the reports.
segment.target: Specifies the domain user group that has read permissions to the reports.

segment.source: The specified group must be the same group that is used for the ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup parameter in the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet.
segment.target: The specified group must be the same group that is used for the ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup parameter in the Enable-MbamWebApplication cmdlet.

segment.source: Enable-MBAMWebApplication
segment.target: Enable-MBAMWebApplication

segment.source: AdvancedHelpdeskAccessGroup
segment.target: AdvancedHelpdeskAccessGroup

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: Specifies the domain Users group that has access to all areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website except the Reports area.
segment.target: Specifies the domain Users group that has access to all areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website except the Reports area.

segment.source: HelpdeskAccessGroup
segment.target: HelpdeskAccessGroup

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: Specifies the domain Users group that has access to the Manage TPM and Drive Recovery areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Specifies the domain Users group that has access to the Manage TPM and Drive Recovery areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup
segment.target: ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: Specifies the domain Users group that has read permission to the Reports area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Specifies the domain Users group that has read permission to the Reports area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: The specified group must be the same group that is used for the ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup parameter in the Enable-MbamReport cmdlet.
segment.target: The specified group must be the same group that is used for the ReportsReadOnlyAccessGroup parameter in the Enable-MbamReport cmdlet.

segment.source: WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential
segment.target: WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential

segment.source: User
segment.target: User

segment.source: Specifies the domain user to be used by the application pool for the MBAM web applications.
segment.target: Specifies the domain user to be used by the application pool for the MBAM web applications.

segment.source: It must be the same domain user account that is specified in the AccessAccount parameter of the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet.
segment.target: It must be the same domain user account that is specified in the AccessAccount parameter of the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet.

segment.source: If a domain Users group was used by the AccessAccount parameter when running the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet, the domain user that is specified here must be a member of that group.
segment.target: If a domain Users group was used by the AccessAccount parameter when running the Enable-MbamDatabase cmdlet, the domain user that is specified here must be a member of that group.

segment.source: If you do not specify the administrative credentials, the administrative credentials that were specified by any previously enabled web application are used.
segment.target: If you do not specify the administrative credentials, the administrative credentials that were specified by any previously enabled web application are used.

segment.source: All of the web applications use the same application pool identity.
segment.target: All of the web applications use the same application pool identity.

segment.source: If it is specified multiple times, the most recently specified value is used.
segment.target: If it is specified multiple times, the most recently specified value is used.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For improved security, set the account that is specified in the administrative credentials to limited user rights.
segment.target: For improved security, set the account that is specified in the administrative credentials to limited user rights.

segment.source: Also, set the password of the account to never expire.
segment.target: Also, set the password of the account to never expire.

segment.source: Ensure that either the built-in IISIUSRS account or the account that is used for the WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential parameter has been added to the Impersonate a client after authentication local security setting.
segment.target: Ensure that either the built-in IISIUSRS account or the account that is used for the WebServiceApplicationPoolCredential parameter has been added to the Impersonate a client after authentication local security setting.

segment.source: To view the local security setting, open the Local Security Policy editor, expand the Local Policies node, select the User Rights Assignment node, and then double-click the Impersonate a client after authentication and Log on as a batch job Group Policy settings in the details pane.
segment.target: To view the local security setting, open the Local Security Policy editor, expand the Local Policies node, select the User Rights Assignment node, and then double-click the Impersonate a client after authentication and Log on as a batch job Group Policy settings in the details pane.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
